####The singleton scope()
singleton bean bean

Application

@Component

The prototype scope()

The non-singleton, prototype scope of bean deployment results in the creation of a new bean instance every time a request for that specific bean is made. That is, the bean is injected into another bean or you request it through a getBean() method call on the container. As a rule, use the prototype scope for all stateful beans and the singleton scope for stateless beans.

Post._content:
Docker[Docker](https://docs.docker.com/install/linux/docker-ce/centos/)<!-- more -->

### 
#### 
CentOS7`centos-extras`
``` shell
[root@ip-172-26-13-79 centos]# yum repolist                                                                              
fastestmirror
Repodata is over 2 weeks old. Install yum-cron? Or run: yum makecache fast
Loading mirror speeds from cached hostfile
 * base: centos.usonyx.net
 * epel: download.nus.edu.sg
 * extras: centos.usonyx.net
 * updates: centos.usonyx.net
                                                                                                       
!base/7/x86_64                             CentOS-7 - Base                                                         10,019
!epel/x86_64                               Extra Packages for Enterprise Linux 7 - x86_64                          13,221
!extras/7/x86_64                           CentOS-7 - Extras                                                          409
!updates/7/x86_64                          CentOS-7 - Updates                                                       1,982
repolist: 25,631
[root@ip-172-26-13-79 centos]#
```
,[](https://fedoraproject.org/wiki/EPEL)
``` shell
[root@ip-172-26-13-79 centos]# yum install https://dl.fedoraproject.org/pub/epel/epel-release-latest-7.noarch.rpm
# on RHEL 7 it is recommended to also enable the optional, extras, and HA repositories since EPEL packages may depend on packages from these repositorie
[root@ip-172-26-13-79 centos]# subscription-manager repos --enable "rhel-*-optional-rpms" --enable "rhel-*-extras-rpms"  --enable "rhel-ha-for-rhel-*-server-rpms"
```
`overlay2` storage driver
#### 
``` shell
sudo yum remove docker \
                  docker-client \
                  docker-client-latest \
                  docker-common \
                  docker-latest \
                  docker-latest-logrotate \
                  docker-logrotate \
                  docker-engine
```


### 
Docker CE
-  `Dokcer's repositories` 
- RPM 
- Dokcer

#### repository 
#####  REPOSITORY
1.
``` shell
$ sudo yum install -y yum-utils \
  device-mapper-persistent-data \
  lvm2
```
2.repository
``` shell
sudo yum-config-manager \
    --add-repo \
    https://download.docker.com/linux/centos/docker-ce.repo
```
##### nightlytest repositories
1.docker.repo 
``` shell
$ sudo yum-config-manager --enable docker-ce-nightly
```
2.test channel
``` shell
sudo yum-config-manager --enable docker-ce-test
```
3.
``` shell
sudo yum-config-manager --disable docker-ce-nightly
```
[ nightly  test channels](https://docs.docker.com/install/)

##### Docker CE

``` shell
$ sudo yum install docker-ce docker-ce-cli containerd.io
```

``` bash

git --version
```

> Python

Python PythonPython<!-- more -->

### Pyenv
``` bash
sudo yum -y install zlib-devel bzip2-devel openssl-devel ncurses-devel sqlite-devel readline-devel tk-devel gdbm-devel db4-devel libpcap-devel xz-devel  #
```


``` bash
#
mkdir ~/.pyenv
git clone git://github.com/yyuu/pyenv.git ~/.pyenv  
#
echo 'export PYENV_ROOT="$HOME/.pyenv"' >> ~/.bashrc  
echo 'export PATH="$PYENV_ROOT/bin:$PATH"' >> ~/.bashrc  
echo 'eval "$(pyenv init -)"' >> ~/.bashrc  
exec $SHELL -l
```
```

``` bash
#
pyenv install --list

#python 3.5.2
pyenv install 3.5.2

#
pyenv global 3.5.2

#
python --version
```

### Volume(Volume  Volume)<!-- more -->

#### Volume mongo-data
``` Shell
docker volume create --name mongo-data
```

#### 
```
docker pull mongo
```

#### 
```
docker run --restart="always" \
          -d \
          --name mongo\
          -p 17017:27017\
          -v mongo-data:/data/db\
          -v /etc/localtime:/etc/localtime\
          mongo:latest --storageEngine wiredTiger -auth
```

` --storageEngine` MongoDB ,wiredTiger
`-auth` Mongo

#### mongo
```
docker exec -it mongo mongo admin
```

###  user123 :123456
```
db.createUser({user: "user123",pwd: "123456",roles: [ { role: "userAdminAnyDatabase", db: "admin" } ]})
```

Post._content:
### 
GitHubGitLabGitee JenkinsJenkinswebhook<!-- more -->
### webhook
>webhoowebhttppush APIAPPWebhookAPI

>WebhookAPIAPIAPIWebhookhttppost

### webhook
webhook 

   CentOS7
   GiteeGitHub
- 
1. 
``` bash
ssh-keygen -t rsa -C "xxxxx@xxxxx.com"  

# Generating public/private rsa key pair...
#  ssh key
```
2. 
``` bash
cat ~/.ssh/id_rsa.pub
# ssh-rsa AAAAB3NzaC1yc2EAAAADAQABAAABAQC6eNtGpNGwstc....
```
3. 
![](gitee-with-webhook/image-2018-153940@2x.png)
4. 
``` bash
ssh -T git@gitee.com
Welcome to Gitee.com, yourname! # 
```

- node
1. nvmnvm node
``` bash
curl -o- https://raw.githubusercontent.com/creationix/nvm/v0.33.8/install.sh | bash
vim /etc/profile
#
export NVM_DIR="$HOME/.nvm"
[ -s "$NVM_DIR/nvm.sh" ] && \. "$NVM_DIR/nvm.sh"
source /etc/profile
nvm install stable # 
nvm current # 
```
2. 
gitee-webhook-handler(GitHub,GitLab,gitee )
``` bash
mkdir /opt/webhook #
cd /opt/webhook
npm init # 
npm install  gitee-webhook-handler --save # v0.1.2
```
3. webhook
``` bash
vim webhook.js

var http = require('http')
var createHandler = require('gitee-webhook-handler')
var handler = createHandler({ path: '/webhooks_push', secret: '123456' })# post 

function run_cmd(cmd, args, callback) {
  var spawn = require('child_process').spawn;
  var child = spawn(cmd, args);
  var resp = "";
  child.stdout.on('data', function(buffer) { resp += buffer.toString(); });
  child.stdout.on('end', function() { callback (resp) });
}
handler.on('error', function (err) {
  console.error('Error:', err.message)
})
handler.on('Push Hook', function (event) {  # GitHub  Gitee 
  console.log('Received a push event for %s to %s',
    event.payload.repository.name,
    event.payload.ref);
    run_cmd('sh', ['./deploy.sh'], function(text){ console.log(text) });# 
})
try {
  http.createServer(function (req, res) {
    handler(req, res, function (err) {
      res.statusCode = 404
      res.end('no such location')
    })
  }).listen(6666) # 
}catch(err){
  console.error('Error:', err.message)
}
```
4. 
``` bash
vim deploy.sh
git pull xxxxx  # 
```
5. 
![](gitee-with-webhook/WX20180225-163439@2x.png)
![](gitee-with-webhook/WX20180225-163748@2x.png)
ok

### pm2
node pm2
``` bash
npm install -g pm2
pm2 start webhook.js
pm2 monit # 
```

### kubeadm, kubelet and kubectl
``` bash
$ cat <<EOF > /etc/yum.repos.d/kubernetes.repo
[kubernetes]
name=Kubernetes
baseurl=https://packages.cloud.google.com/yum/repos/kubernetes-el7-x86_64
enabled=1
gpgcheck=1
repo_gpgcheck=1
gpgkey=https://packages.cloud.google.com/yum/doc/yum-key.gpg https://packages.cloud.google.com/yum/doc/rpm-package-key.gpg
EOF
$ setenforce 0 #SELinux
$ yum install -y kubelet kubeadm kubectl
$ systemctl enable kubelet && systemctl start kubelet # 
```
yum --enablerepo=kubernetes clean metadata
``` bash
$ yum --enablerepo=kubernetes clean metadata # 
$ yum clean metadata
$ yum clean all
$ rm -rf /var/cache/yum
```
###  kubeadm

###

### 
ssh socks5 
``` bash
$ ssh -f -N -D bindaddress:port name@server
$ ssh -f -N -D 0.0.0.0:1080 root@45.63.61.77
```
- -f

(Requests ssh to go to background just before command execution.)
- -N
,
( Do not execute a remote command. This is useful for just for warding ports (protocol version 2 only).)
- -D
socket5
(Specifies a local dynamic application-level port forwarding.Currently the SOCKS4 and SOCKS5 protocols are supported, and ssh will act as a SOCKS server.)
- -L
tcp
(Specifies that the given port on the local (client) host is to be forwarded to the given host and port on the remote side.)
- -C
,
(Compression is desirable on modem lines and other slow connections, but will only slow down things on fast networks.The compression algorithm is the same used by gzip)

bindaddress ip
port  
name ssh
server ssh

#!/usr/bin/env python
# encoding: utf-8

import pandas as pd

movies = pd.read_csv('https://blog.searchinfogo.com/download/data/data/imdb_1000.csv')
print(movies.head())
print(movies.shape)

print(type(True))

booleans = []
for length in movies.duration:
    if length >= 20:
        booleans.append(True)
    else:
        booleans.append(False)

booleans[0:5]

len(booleans)

is_long = pd.Series(booleans)
is_long.head()

is_long = movies.duration >= 200
is_long.head()
movies['genre']

movies[movies.duration >= 200]['genre']
movies[is_long]

Post.title: UbuntuLAMP
Post._content:
### LAMP
 Linux+Apache+Mysql/MariaDB+Perl/PHP/PythonWeb<!-- more -->
### 
Ubuntu
### 

``` bash
$ apt-get update && sudo apt-get upgrade #
```
#### MySQL
```bash
$ sudo apt-get install -y mysql-server
$ sudo apt-get install -y mysql-client
! 
```


 ``` bash
 $ sudo netstat -tap | grep mysql #
 ```

#### 
``` bash
$ vim /etc/mysql/mysql.conf.d/mysqld.cnf
#bind-address = 127.0.0.1
```
#### 
``` bash
$ mysql -u root -p
$ grant all on *.* to root@'%' identified by 'root';
$ flush privileges;  
$ exit
$ service mysql restart(or: $ /etc/init.d/mysql restart)# 
```
####Apache2

```bash
$ sudo apt-get install -y apache2
```

``` bash
#apache2.conf
$ vi /etc/apache2/apache2.conf
$ KeepAlive Off
#mpm_prefork.conf
$ vim /etc/apache2/mods-available/mpm_prefork.conf
 <IfModule mpm_prefork_module>
   StartServers            2
   MinSpareServers         6
   MaxSpareServers         12
   MaxRequestWorkers       39
   MaxConnectionsPerChild  3000
</IfModule>

#
$ sudo a2dismod mpm_event
$ sudo a2enmod mpm_prefork
$ sudo systemctl restart apache2 #Apache
```
#### PHP 
``` bash
# 
$ sudo apt-get install php7.0 php-pear libapache2-mod-php7.0 php7.0-mysql -y
# 
apt-get install php7.0-curl php7.0-json php7.0-cgi graphviz aspell php7.0-pspell php7.0-curl php7.0-gd php7.0-intl php7.0-mysql php7.0-xml php7.0-xmlrpc php7.0-ldap php7.0-zip php7.0-soap php7.0-mbstring php-gettext -y
# 
$ sudo systemctl restart apache2

```

#### phpmyadmin 
``` bash

$ sudo apt-get install -y phpmyadmin
#php
$ sudo apt-get install -y php-mbstring
$ sudo apt-get install -y php-gettext
#root
#php/usr/share/php/php-gettext/gettext.inc

#
$ sudo ln -s /usr/share/phpmyadmin /var/www/html/phpmyadmin
#apache
$ sudo /etc/init.d/apache2 restart
#http://localhost:127.0.0.1/phpmyadmin mysql 
```

Post.title: centos yum nginx
Post._content:
### yum yum ### yumnginx CentOS Linux release 7.4.1708 (Core) #### 1. ``` shell rpm -ivh http://nginx.org/packages/centos/7/noarch/RPMS/nginx-release-centos-7-0.el7.ngx.noarch.rpm ``` #### 2.nginx ``` shell yum info nginx (nginx ) ``` #### 3.yumnginx ``` shell yum -y install nginx ``` ### nginx #### 1. ``` shell rpm -ql nginx ``` #### 2. ``` shell nginx -V ``` #### 3.nginx ``` shell systemctl start nginx # nginx systemctl stop nginx # nginx systemctl restart nginx # nginx ``` ### ``` shell curl -i localhost ``` #### ``` html

Welcome to nginx!

``` ### `yum``nginx` `yum``nginx` #### 1. ``` shell yum -y install gcc gcc-c++ make libtool zlib zlib-devel openssl openssl-devel pcre pcre-devel ``` #### 2. `nginx -V` yum nginx 1.12.1, ``` shell cd /opt wget http://nginx.org/download/nginx-1.12.1.tar.gz ``` #### 3.configure ``` shell tar xf nginx-1.12.1.tar.gz cd nginx-1.12.1 nginx -V configure arguments: --prefix=/etc/nginx \ --sbin-path=/usr/sbin/nginx \ --conf-path=/etc/nginx/nginx.conf \ ... ``` #### 4. ``` shell ./configure --prefix=/etc/nginx \ --sbin-path=/usr/sbin/nginx \ --conf-path=/etc/nginx/nginx.conf \ ... --add-module=../headers-more-nginx-module ``` #### 5. ``` shell make && make install ``` #### 6. ``` shell cp /usr/sbin/nginx /usr/sbin/nginx.bak # cp /opt/nginx-1.12.1/objs/nginx /usr/sbin/nginx # systemctl restart nginx # nginx ```
